meanings.sent1: After playing outside, I quench my thirst with a glass of water.
meanings.sent2: It is important to quench your thirst regularly to stay healthy.
meanings.sent3: I always quench my thirst with a big gulp of lemonade after a long walk.
meanings.sent4: Her thirst for knowledge was quenched by reading books all day.
meanings.sent5: The refreshing drink quenched my thirst instantly.

meanings.sent1: The firefighters worked hard to quench the fire in the building.
meanings.sent2: Using water to quench the flames is a common firefighting technique.
meanings.sent3: The fire alarm went off, and everyone rushed to quench the small kitchen fire.
meanings.sent4: His quick thinking helped to quench the fire before it spread further.
meanings.sent5: The fire extinguisher was used to quench the flames effectively.

meanings.definition: Cooling a hot metal rapidly by immersion in water or oil.
meanings.sent1: The blacksmith demonstrated quenching the red-hot metal in a bucket of water.
meanings.sent2: Quenching is essential in the metalworking process to achieve the desired hardness.
meanings.sent3: The loud sizzle echoed in the workshop as the blacksmith performed the quenching process.
meanings.sent4: The sudden quenching of the metal created a cloud of steam in the air.
meanings.sent5: The quenching of the metal transformed its properties instantly.
